summary: The bill, titled the Curb Private Utilities Corruption Act (CPUC Act), amends the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978. It mandates that each state regulatory authority consider requiring public disclosure of meetings between its employees/board members and lobbyists or representatives of electric utilities. States must make a determination on implementing this standard within a year of the bill's enactment. It aims to increase transparency in dealings between regulatory bodies and utility companies.
